name: Collier's Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I were away on a 10 day trip and needed to fill two days prior to getting the tunnel back to the UK.
reviews.title: What a lovely little find!

reviews.text: This B and B was recommended to us by friends and we were very glad we took up on their advice!
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B near Brugge train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very easy to get to from Calais, about an hours relaxed drive and it was especially easy to find, following the directions on the website, and although there is no parking at the B and B (which is the "norm" throughout the city as its very pedestrain and bike orientated) generally, you can park up outside to drop off luggage and stuff before putting the car in the local car park (3 min walk, 2.40 euro a day and quite secure as everyone uses it).
reviews.title: Christmas shopping

likes.disliked: — Nothing, it's very authentic and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is quite unobstusive, look for the house number to find it, and its gorgeous! It has recently been renoveated to a very high standard. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was yum with fresh, hot rolls...
reviews.title: Beautiful Brugge

description: Collier's is charming 3 story Flemish house overlooking the park. Located on a quiet side road but only 10mins walk from the Grote Markt. It ensures a restful stay but is close to all Brugge has to offer.The rooms are located on the 2nd and 3rd floors, all have TV and ensuite facilities. They were all recently decorated to a very high standard.Breakfast is included in the room price.
